intro: Sericolea gracilis, commonly known as the slender sericolea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Sericolea gracilis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
